byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Cairo, and Saeed al-Batati from Al Mukalla, Yemen. Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva, and Shuaib Almosawa from Sana, Yemen.
byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and SAEED AL-BATATI

abstract: United Nations-mediated negotiations to end Yemen’s civil war end without resolution; UN official Ismail Ould Cheikh Ahmed says while there was some progress at Switzerland meeting, talks were ruined by repeated violations of cease-fire between Houthi insurgents and Yemen’s government; negotiations are set to resume in January 2016.
lead_paragraph: Negotiations brokered by the United Nations ended with no sign of a resolution to the civil war in Yemen and with the combatants engaged in some of their fiercest fighting in months, officials said.

headline.main: Yemen Peace Talks End With No End to Conflict
headline.print_headline: Yemen Peace Talks End With No End to Conflict

snippet: Negotiations brokered by the United Nations ended with no sign of a resolution to the civil war in Yemen and with the combatants engaged in some of their fiercest fighting in months, officials said.
